chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall p q : Z, rel_prime p q -> distinct_parity p q -> rel_prime (Z.mul (Z.mul 2 p) q) (Z.add (Z.mul p p) (Z.mul q q))

Premises:
rel_prime = fun a b : Z => Zis_gcd a b 1 : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments rel_prime (_ _)%Z_scope
N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
distinct_parity = fun a b : Z => Zeven a /\ Zodd b \/ Zodd a /\ Zeven b : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments distinct_parity (_ _)%Z_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
N.add = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => m | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos q => N.pos (p + q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.add (_ _)%N_scope
relp_pq1 : forall p q : Z, p >= 0 -> p <= q -> rel_prime p q -> distinct_parity p q -> rel_prime (q * q - p * p) (p * p + q * q)
distp_sqr1 : forall p q : Z, distinct_parity p q -> distinct_parity (p * p) (q * q)
distp_sqr2 : forall p q : Z, distinct_parity (p * p) (q * q) -> distinct_parity p q
rel_prime_div : forall p q r : Z, rel_prime p q -> (r | p) -> rel_prime r q
distp_odd : forall p q : Z, distinct_parity p q -> both_odd (p + q) (q - p)
rel_prime_mod_rev : forall p q : Z, 0 < q -> rel_prime (p mod q) q -> rel_prime p q
rel_prime_mod : forall p q : Z, 0 < q -> rel_prime p q -> rel_prime (p mod q) q
prop4 : forall p q : Z, 0 <= p -> 0 <= q -> rel_prime p q -> is_sqr (p * q) -> is_sqr p /\ is_sqr q
distp_neq : forall p q : Z, distinct_parity p q -> p <> q
prop4b : forall p q : Z, 0 <= p -> 0 <= q -> p <= q -> rel_prime p q -> is_sqr (p * (q * (q * q - p * p))) -> is_sqr p /\ is_sqr q /\ is_sqr (q * q - p * p)
Z.add_lt_mono : forall n m p q : Z, n < m -> p < q -> n + p < m + q
Z.mul_shuffle2 : forall n m p q : Z, n * m * (p * q) = n * q * (m * p)
Z.mul_shuffle1 : forall n m p q : Z, n * m * (p * q) = n * p * (m * q)
prime_intro : forall p : Z, 1 < p -> (forall n : Z, 1 <= n < p -> rel_prime n p) -> prime p
prime_rect : forall (p : Z) (P : Type), (1 < p -> (forall n : Z, 1 <= n < p -> rel_prime n p) -> P) -> prime p -> P
prime_ind : forall (p : Z) (P : Prop), (1 < p -> (forall n : Z, 1 <= n < p -> rel_prime n p) -> P) -> prime p -> P
prime_sind : forall (p : Z) (P : SProp), (1 < p -> (forall n : Z, 1 <= n < p -> rel_prime n p) -> P) -> prime p -> P
Zdivide_intro : forall a b q : Z, b = q * a -> (a | b)
not_prime_gen : forall a b : Z, 1 < a -> 1 < b -> b < a -> ~ prime a -> (forall c : Z, b < c < a -> rel_prime c a) -> exists q b0 : Z, a = q * b0 /\ 1 < q /\ 1 < b0
prime_rel_prime : forall p : Z, prime p -> forall a : Z, ~ (p | a) -> rel_prime p a
Inductive prime (p : Z) : Prop := prime_intro : 1 < p -> (forall n : Z, 1 <= n < p -> rel_prime n p) -> prime p Arguments prime _%Z_scope Arguments prime_intro _%Z_scope _ _%function_scope
Zis_gcd_for_euclid2 : forall b d q r : Z, Zis_gcd r b d -> Zis_gcd b (b * q + r) d
Z.divide_mul_r : forall n m p : Z, (n | p) -> (n | m * p)
Z.divide_add_r : forall n m p : Z, (n | m) -> (n | p) -> (n | m + p)
Z.divide_sub_r : forall n m p : Z, (n | m) -> (n | p) -> (n | m - p)

```coq
intros p q Hrp Hd.
assert (Hpq : rel_prime (Z.mul 2 p) q).
  apply rel_prime_mod_rev with (q := q).
  auto.
  apply rel_prime_div with (p := 2).
  auto.
  apply Z.divide_add_r with (n := 2) (m := p) (p := p).
  auto.
  apply Z.divide_refl.
assert (Hppq : rel_prime (Z.mul p p) (Z.mul q q)).
  apply relp_pq1 with (p := p) (q := q).
  auto.
  auto.
  apply rel_prime_mod with (p := p) (q := q).
  auto.
  auto.
assert (Hdq : distinct_parity (Z.mul p p) (Z.mul q q)).
  apply distp_sqr1 with (p := p) (q := q).
  auto.
assert (H2pq : rel_prime (Z.mul (Z.mul 2 p) q) (Z.add (Z.mul p p) (Z.mul q q))).
  apply relp_pq1 with (p := Z.mul 2 p) (q := Z.add (Z.mul p p) (Z.mul q q)).
  auto.
  apply Z.add_lt_mono with (n := p * p) (m := q * q) (p := 0) (q := 0).
  auto.
  auto.
  apply rel_prime_mod with (p := Z.mul 2 p) (q := Z.add (Z.mul p p) (Z.mul q q)).
  auto.
  auto.
apply H2pq.
Qed.```

original: intros p q Hrp Hd. assert (Hpq : rel_prime (Z.mul 2 p) q). apply rel_prime_mod_rev with (q := q). auto. apply rel_prime_div with (p := 2). auto. apply Z.divide_add_r with (n := 2) (m := p) (p := p). auto. apply Z.divide_refl. assert (Hppq : rel_prime (Z.mul p p) (Z.mul q q)). apply relp_pq1 with (p := p) (q := q). auto. auto. apply rel_prime_mod with (p := p) (q := q). auto. auto. assert (Hdq : distinct_parity (Z.mul p p) (Z.mul q q)). apply distp_sqr1 with (p := p) (q := q). auto. assert (H2pq : rel_prime (Z.mul (Z.mul 2 p) q) (Z.add (Z.mul p p) (Z.mul q q))). apply relp_pq1 with (p := Z.mul 2 p) (q := Z.add (Z.mul p p) (Z.mul q q)). auto. apply Z.add_lt_mono with (n := p * p) (m := q * q) (p := 0) (q := 0). auto. auto. apply rel_prime_mod with (p := Z.mul 2 p) (q := Z.add (Z.mul p p) (Z.mul q q)). auto. auto. apply H2pq.
